reviews.text: Enjoyed listening to the history of the cemetery while on my night tour. You are not allowed to use your cell phone flash light because according to the guide it negatively affects the paint and structure of the building. You can use a regular handheld flashlight if you wish. The night time tours are busy and I presume that most people visit during that time because it's morbid and spooky. If you are more of a history and/or architecture buff then you are better off visiting during the day so you can truly appreciate your surroundings.

Offerings are eaten/stolen?? (brought american m&m's in the night tour and came in morning to take pictures (couldnt take pics at night) and they were missing??? Although mexican candy was still there??) It is a good tour for the most part. Tour guides provide information/stories that are interesting. Only about half of the tour is wheelchair accessible. If you wanna see the story of the maiden's shadow/ enter the mauselum you have to go with you own assistance/companion. Mauselum steps are slippery if you are of old age/have a disability.
It is a mysterious place and have a lot of historical facts.

My visit was great. I learned that a notable American is buried along  perhaps some free masons and some other foreign personages. Our guide let us know that that the buildings design incorporates mason's rules and traditions. For example the columns represent the marks on a mason's square. I especially liked the echo display at the corner of the building. Take one step forward and you hear the echo, take one step back and you don't. Very interesting and full of information. I cannot remember half of the hour and so tour. They have night tours as well where they dwell in more detail on the myths and stories about the people buried there.  Too bad I did not have enough time for the night run. The only drawback is the museum is only slowly getting maintained. I only wish it would be in better repair. Good visit thought with a lot of interesting points. Don't forget to buy your tickets at the little window to the right of the main gate. They charge extra for the use of the camera inside. No flash is allowed to preserve the building and no touching of surfaces or wondering around. They stated they had to do that because some visitors painted graffiti while other broke things. Despite the restrictions the guide was great and you can wonder a little as long as you are near your main group.  Ticket prices are very reasonable. My tour was all in Spanish.
Lil
Show!

É claro que não seria algo grandioso pois o Governador Valadares é uma cidade pequena. Ademais, havia uma área não completa que parecia ser meio abandonada. No entanto, o conteúdo apresentado neste museu é muito informador sobre a cidade, verdadeiramente aprendi muito sobre a cidade do meu pai e senti mais orgulho da história da minha família. Além do mais, a arquitetura antiga preservada agrada os olhos. O atendimento também foi ótimo, as moças que trabalham lá conversavam conosco e nos ofereciam mais informações sobre o museu e a cidade. É uma pena que muitos não conhecem este museu, pois realmente vale a pena o visitar para conhecer cada vez mais a nossa história!
Uma excelente opção para conhecer a história de Governador Valadares. O acervo poderia melhorar. A planta original da cidade precisa de restauração urgente.
Me surpreendeu. Apesar do espaço ser alugado, tem muitos atrativos e retrata a história da cidade. Mais pessoas deveriam conhecer.
Relembrei de coisas que fizeram parte da minha família e da minha vida.
A good option for a day out with your family
Nice place to stroll around for a while , but it is dirty at some places, specially the market area around it. There are cafes around to sit and relax.
Beautiful historic plaza
Lots of architecture to enjoy
Great place to walk
A small but nice place.
Muy linda, falta que la iluminacion se encienda en la noche.... esta, pero apagada
Uma praça encantadora, com muitos restaurantes e lojas que remetem ao período vintage.
科洛尼亞老城最中心的廣場，週邊是各種歷史古蹟，遊客雲集。
Ciudad vieja en reconstrucción.
Beautiful place! Packed full of history with gorgeous architecture to keep your eyes feasting.
Beautiful both at daytime and at night. Reasonably priced 24 hour parking available as well.
This is a quiet and beautiful place, you can see the great and classic architecture in all the builds

Great place to walk and learn about Guadalajara's culture, wonderful views and places to eat. I recommend you to visit the Teatro Degollado and the Hospicio Cabañas, excellent buildings and a lot of history. Both have Spanish and English guides.
Guadalajara Downtown...it used to be dirty a year before, this year when I see it I was surprised to see the turnaround, it a lively place with all the cleanliness around.....
Come inside and look at the murals on the wall. Super cool!
The murals tell the history of Mexico. A must see.
Must visit landmark in Chihuahua. The interior walls are decorated with murals illustrating the history of Mexico
Amazing art work inside about history, building is amazing
Impressive building, pretty well kept

Would spend no more than 2 hours here, lots of rooms, some of them locked. What attracted me to the place as I assume is the case with a lot of others was the skeleton of the woolly mammoth. If you’re only coming here to see that, it does not disappoint. It’s amazing how well preserved this specimen is. The tusks on the skeleton are almost unbelievably large.

Majority of the info is in Spanish. I don't know how they selected the pieces that had English information.
I don't understand how they organized their collections. Things seemed randomly placed, jumping times/subjects and overall a little hard to follow.
Loved this museum it shows alot of culture and history the best part was the Gian Mammoth.
It is good for expensing some time and knowing some of history. However, since my perspective, it has a lack of interesting events. It could be better
We took the kids here and they had fun. The museum was celebrating 100 years.

This church is absolutely beautiful, especially at night! Its light hits it just right! The cool thing about this church is that exactly at each out the bells will ring and the saints with come out in a circle in one of its towers!
You should visit if you go to Leon, not only is a nice place but also full of history, plus... There are really good ice creams at the corner!

One of the biggest places in Guadalajara for Catholic people and photographers of churches, an atmosphere so quietly and peaceful for believers. A wonderful architecture with such much detail in it, and so much history running inside and outside of the church.
Gorgeous church! Everything about felt so peaceful. And the detailing of the church is amazing!

Gorgeous church in Guadalajara. There's a surprise when you go on the hour. Adorable clock apostle dolls come out when the bell chimes. My boyfriend and I enjoy it a lot. I have been to some cathedrals in Europe and Mexico, and it's one of my favorite churches and my first time to see the apostle dolls dancing on the bell towers. If you come to the central of this city, don't miss the show and take a view inside of the temple respectfully.
You should visit it if you can :)
Me encanta ir alla es un lugar muy Lindo y pasar el rato alla es muy agradable  me encanta
Maravilloso lugar no cabe duda ke tenemos un mexico con lugares fantasticos
No le encuentro sentido al monumento

Un lugar historico y sobre todo tradicional de León Guanajuato, ya que en contra esquina encuentras en grandioso Arco de la Calzada, símbolo de la ciudad, a escasos metros se encuentra el templo expiatorio, considerado uno de los mejores de México, cerca de ahi esta el centro histórico donde encontraras todo tipo de tiendas, es un buen lugar para pasar un domingo familiar, además de la cercanía de varios restaurantes y bares, zona de bares a 5 minutos
Best place to jog and run in guadalajara sundays mass is at 8 o'clock dont miss it

This is a beautiful canyon that has a lovely hike if you turn right when you get to the canyon from the parking lot.  There are a few things we didn't love. You hear lots of gunshots ar the top of the canyon because there is a police shooting range. And there is a small waterfall of sewage about halfway down the hike that smells awful. But the scenery is super beautiful.

It's a very good place in Guadalajara.. interesting place. Canyon in Guadalajara..a full day outing is very good here .horse ride, small train ride, waterfall and good scenic beauty..public transport available always..only tiffin and snacks shop available not meals there,so prepared for this.
It was a great walk!!!!! So green and beautiful I recommend to anyone who visits Guadalajara.

No Dogs Allowed (official rules).  I read so many reviews and posts saying that dogs were indeed allowed so I took my two furbabies only to be turned away by two police officers who were monitoring the entrance. It's a beautiful place and was super easy to get to and find all day parking for only $15. I did see lots of visitors with their dogs and they were able to enter the park when the officers left their post to help an injured hiker. It seemed as though I was one of a few people who happened to be turned away.
Outstanding. First world location, reminded me of Europe .

It's a good place to spend some time with your family or your partner, but it's a park a little neglected. Personally, I prefer this park on a Saturday, after visiting the "Tianguis Cultural" in the Benito Juárez place.
Beautiful natural setting in a big city
Nice well cleaned very nice clean and quite park good for a walk theater shows
Buenos toquines

Really good food. All of it was fresh. My only problem is that my glass for water was dirty but they quickly fixed that. The place was very cool. There was a outside patio that was clean. I got a scone that was really fresh and soft it was so delicious.I highly recommend this restaurant.

Decent restaurant and shows its popularity with the long line ups. The host seems to be friendlier to families instead of individuals in my case. After lining up for 30 minutes, the host finally asks if I needed a number whereas everyone before and after me on the line has been asked that. And it turns out, if I sit at the bar, I can skip the line up. They can probably work on the service levels a bit there.

The burger was good though! The produce served with the burger was fresh. The lettuce was falling apart as it as diced. And mine was served with chips.

I'll consider coming back with friends, but will try the numerous other options on the street if by myself.

The food was delicious. Healthy options and lots of good flavor. The breakfasts are to die for. The dinner menu was varied with lots of interesting salads, soups, sandwiches, and entrees from fish or chicken to veggie burgers. The atmosphere is bosonic and modern art the same time. Outdoor dining is also available. The fatal flaw is there ordering process. You have to stand in line to order and there is only one register with one gal getting drink cups, lemons, answering questions about the menu, taking the order and making change. Ridiculously long wait. They need to streamline something there. The gender neutral bathrooms are also a plus.

Always great! First time enjoying breakfast.  Lots of options including vegetarian and vegan. Although the wait may be typical it is in most restaurants on Gilbert.  Good arrives quickly and is high quality even on a busy Sunday brunch hour . Drinks are on look t as well as desert .

While exploring downtown old Gilbert, liberty Market was our random lunch place choice. 
 We had two of their panini sandwiches and their Ruben, all three were excellent and  huge, we each took half a sandwich home. Yes, they were still delicious the next day. The coffee was excellent. 
The room appears to be a converted grocery market, we were in for a late lunch, the place was busy but not crowded, the staff were very friendly and the service was fast.
All in all a very nice place, which deserves a revisit to explore more of the menu.
Really nice plaza (MALL). For sure they keep it clean and fresh. Everytime I come for a walk to kill some time I always fine diferent decorations and diferent stores.
Pet Friendly
All you want in this place

Primer centro comercial de Jalisco con casi 50 años de antigüedad.  100% vigente y funcional con tiendas de prestigio y restaurantes.  Al atardecer se puede disfrutar del espectáculo de miles de pájaros que llegan a pasar la noche en los árboles del estacionamiento.

Un gran centro comercial de tradición en Guadalajara. Con diversas tiendas de autoservicio y tiendas especializadas en diferentes productos. Puedes encontrar casi todo lo que necesites y con acceso a todos los bolsillos...

The food is good, I ate there twice . Large portions of food for a good price. There tends to be a line at times, depending on the time of day (mornings are better).  The line goes pretty fast and you get your food quickly. 

The waiter situation is a bit odd. I was not sure who served me, where he was when I needed my bill or had questions.i guess you can always stop someone and ask for help.
 
Clean restroom and clean environment.

The service was friendly and inviting. There was a line to get in, so you know the place is good. We loved the soups we ordered, and the clan was delicious. This is a great spot to try the state dish, aghobadas.
Delicious food they are very fast bringing out your food.  The waiters are very professional and super friendly.  Highly recommend we were very pleased

Pretty good Mexican food which is very popular with the locals. I found the food a bit bland and underwhelming. It was good but not as great as the hype suggested. Prices were very reasonable though. A solid four star rating.

Great Mexican food, excellent service, superfrendly staff.  Noise level can be too high at times.  Make sure to ask for a side as opposed to a middle table specially if you are tall or have a bigger body, you'll enjoy your meal without space constraints.
great place to eat, food is ample and tasty. music is different most days, and the piano player is amazing! playing classical music is awesome, not very busy most days and staff is very friendly.

Amazing food and even better service. Favorite place to go eat and have breakfast accompanied by great live piano music, not to mention the price of the menu is way affordable. Overall a beautiful place to enjoy a meal
This is an old house conveted into a restaurant. The piano player is great, the food is delicious. The price is very affordable, the portions are huge!
Hard to find a historic restaurant.   This is it!  Hard to stump the pianist.  The fish melted in your mouth.  Our favorite restaurant.
Great food, reasonable prices with the best live piano performance to accompany your meal.

Try the smoked Old Fashioned!  You won't be disappointed.  Awesome service and great food.  My fave is the prime rib which melts in your mouth.  Plenty of parking but can be easy to miss.  It's right behind the Best Buy.

Enjoyed a delicious dinner after staying at the hotel for the night.  Steak was perfectly cooked and prepared.  Had a Sangria pitcher, its very tasty and a must have.  Eaten at a Chop restaurant in other places and this one holds up to the quality you expect.
The food was great, and the staff was even better! Specifically Andy who made the entire experience such a delight! He was so friendly and went above and beyond. Definitely would come back!

The food here was quite good. It was a busy night my meal came over cooked, however they completely replaced it in no time and gave a voucher for another free meal, and not only that they gave my meal free. Great customer service and really appreciate everything thrown in, I was perfectly happy with just my meal cooked to perfection like it was round 2, but thank you

Arriving right at noon, my table of 5 found the lounge area not too busy - we had a table immediately. The wait staff was very friendly and responsive (I had a Pepsi refill before being aware I had finished!). Our meals came out in unison and, to my knowledge, everyone enjoyed what they ordered. However, out of three of us who ordered the steak sandwich, two found the steak less cooked than requested, but only by a thin margin - certainly not enough to dampen the experience. I'll definitely go again and would recommend it to others. Thanks for the experience!!
Upscale dining with authentic Mexican dishes.  Great atmosphere and the food is excellent.  Mid range prices make it affordable.  Perfect for a date night.

The food it's nice and it's not expensive, could be a good option if you have enough time and patience. 
The service takes too much time for everything. 

Btw... Don't go for desserts, there is not something special.
Excelent place! Service and food are incredible with a twist on the traditional Mexican food.

Nice and really authentic restaurant. If you like a  good Mexican food and like to be Part of history this place to be.
Ask waiters what is the story behind this marvellous restaurant.
Highly recommend.

I can describe it as a disappointing visit, expectation were for a recommendation for a place with surprising plates and flavorful preparation. This looks like an old place that has lived their best times, living from memories and not reinvesting in renewing it. Food is a great idea on the menu, half way good in presentation and disappointing on the flavor, lack of taste and not those expected explosive ideas came to reality,  even a simple lemonade was plain. Service is old school, not meaning anything against older people, it is simple that they are not experts on their dishes and they are not able to transmit an experience. I would not recommend, it is not the worst place because they still have that flame in the menu ideas, but they do not materialize them.

Amazing food and decor. Service is quick, perhaps a little too quick. We felt rushed to order when the waiter just stood while we tried to decide. The t bone was incredible flavour and the soup on arrival was really a nice surprise and delicious. Popular with the locals. Definitely will return and be ready this time with order in mind :)

Kamilos was an extremely pleasant experience. After looking at the reviews and pictures other patrons had posted I had a good feeling this place was going to deliver and it did. The waitstaff are very friendly and attentive. I feel if you pick any plate you won't be disappointed. 
I had the carne asada it's called something else here but I didn't catch the name. Sorry! 
Anyway, definitely check this place out you won't be disappointed!
The picture of the food isn't good quality because of low light conditions.
Beautiful restaurant. Beautiful people. Beautiful food. Local Guadalajara foods. Check it out.

this place was packed with locals on a Sunday...still got a table after 15 min..wow..i am going to miss the carne in su sugo when i get home..I will return to guadalajara just for thier food..an experience of a lifetime
Great place for breakfast too. Be aware no carne en su jugo if you arrive before 1100am. But carne enchilada is very good.
Totally overrated. It's always packed but personally I think there are other way better taco places. These tacos are not bad, but they are far from being a great taco.
The gringas de pastor are amazing!! The service is very good and there are many options of meat. This is my preferred taco place in the area.
Many other places ti eat better than this... no need to pay too much for good tacos. This famous-expensive taqueria isn't at the level of other street tacos places.
Real taco stand taco in a Restaurant, run by owners for decades, quality guaranteed and great taste. All kind of tacos!

The tacos here are delicious! I highly recommend the surtidos (they taste great in spite of the ingredients)! Ingredients are fresh and of great quality, also highly regarded by the locals. Definitely also try the jericalla dessert.

Was recieved well initially however as the dinner was served the food was cold.  Waiter was non attentive and forgot to ask if we wanted desert.   Place also looks worn and none of the profits are being invested in the business.  A nice restaurant shouldn't have a TV in the dinning area.  At this rate business won't last. 

 It's a shame could be a great establishment.  Definitely not a first date location you will leave a bad impression.

Loved the food, the service was fantastic. We enjoyed the live music and the ambiance. I would go there often if I lived here!!  Note that in the picture, our butter was wrapped in the corn husk.  Cool!

Very kind servers and the food was delicious. My mom and I decided to share a salad and an entree and they brought our meals already split on two plates "so we wouldn't fight over it."  The atmosphere is so pleasant with the fountain and being outside but with shade and a roof.
Impeccable service. Delicious food and drinks. I want to visit them again.

The food was average, fancy dishes that sound good but the food was bland. The place has a nice courtyard and the waiters discriminate based on how you look or if you’re a tourist. I asked for a factura, left my info and the waiter promised to send it by the end of the day and I still haven’t gotten it. Overall, this place looks good but not really worth it. Tourist trap comes to mind as a good descriptor.

Great food, incredible atmosphere. Take a walk around and take in the pool, the fountain, the bar, the authentic high quality paintings and ceramics! The food was wonderful and the staff were amazingly friendly and engaging.

Beautiful and secluded. Kind of hidden gem in the heart of Tlaquepaque. It's part of the hotel next door. Very intimate, romantic type feel. We went earlier in the evening and there was no entertainment but we were told by the manager Aaron that there was music every night. We felt very welcome and the food was good. Maybe a little more pricey than some other offerings in the area but the exclusive feel and quiet setting was very nice. Will definitely go back.

Realy niceplace good food
excelent service nice atmosphere

I like this place so much!! Live music is a big surprise and romantic. The singer has an excellent vocal and give me a memorable night. I have to say that it's the best restaurant in Tlaquepaque. I have tried Mexican Fillet and Fetuccini Alfredo with chicken, and both dishes are great. I don't speak Spanish but the staffs are friendly and helpful.
Wonderful setting ,outstanding food and very friendly staff.
